title: WCAS STAT 383-0-71 Probability and Statistics for ISP

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
An introduction to probability and statistics, emphasizing scientific
examples and applications. Topics covered include probability spaces,
random variables, expectation and variance, basic limit theorems, one and
two-sample inference, goodness-of-fit tests, principles of estimation,
regression and correlation. The R statistical programming language will be
used throughout.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Ordinarily taken only by students in ISP; special permission required otherwise.

Prerequisites: MATH 281-1,2,3; PHYSICS 125-1,2,3

Students may not receive credit for both 383 and any of 320-1; MATH 310-1, 383, 385; or EECS 302.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The basics of mathematical probability, statistical inference, and data analysis.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: LectureLectures, discussion of examples, reviewing solutions to problem sets.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly problem sets, two hour exams, final project.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Introduction to Mathematical Statistics and Its Applications (5th Edition, 2011), Richard J. Larsen & Morris L. Marx; Pearson Publishing.
ISBN: 978-0321693949.
Price: $153.74

R Cookbook, by Paul Teetor; O'Reilly Media.
ISBN: 978-0596809157.
Price $34.63.

Prices are taken from Amazon.com; no endorsement intended.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Introductory Statistics with R, by Peter Dalgaar, 2nd ed.
Available as a free download from the University Library website.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Weekly notes and detailed solution sets will be distributed.

subject: STAT
